div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of MAC FOCK for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now comes the applicant for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, Mac Fock, through his Counsel of record herein, and moves the United States District Court for an order that the present judge, sitting in this cause, to-wit, his Honor, Judge Cushman, shall proceed no further herein;
I. Because he has personal bias and prejudice against this applicant herein, and the race to which he belongs.
II. Because the affidavit hereto attached and marked Exhibit A states the facts and reasons for the belief that such bias exists.
III. Because the same has been filed within the time required by law, or rather, good cause has been shown for the failure to file within such time.

This motion will be based upon the files and records of this court and the affidavit of the applicant, Mac Fock, hereto attached and marked Exhibit A, to which reference is hereby made for a more particular description of the reasons upon whihc said motion is based.
Dated at Seattle, Washington, this 23rd day of June, 1913.
